Stole $10K+ from small business & overcharged interest on invoicesDo not sign up for Deel as an employer of record for your company!  We had two deposits with Deel as we used them for our Employer of Record.  After we completed our contracts and asked Deel to apply our deposit to our final invoices, we never heard back from the customer success team.  We attempted to contact them for many months about this.  During that time, Deel charged interest on the unpaid invoices.  We therefore went ahead and paid the final invoices for our account so that they would in turn return our deposit.  They only repaid a portion of one deposit.  We have been contacting them weekly for more than 4 months now and they have still not returned our deposit.  This is a serious fraud and unfair given the interest charged on our previously unpaid final invoices given they have not held up their end of the bargain and repaid our deposit once we closed our account AND completed the payments including for the unfair interest charged.  The total they have not refunded us is over $10,000!!Date of experience: January 01, 2024

Highly recommended for founder trying to figure out immigrationFiguring out immigration as a founder is no walk in the park. Obviously, there is some inherent stress in dealing with any complex system, but it's more than that. As a YC founder, every second you are thinking about something other than your company is a second wasted. So you have to figure out how to get immigration right without losing focus. Thankfully Deel and Ahmed Mousa have been amazing allies in navigating this whole process. Always on the ball, Ahmed has answered my endless questions with patience, and there have been a ton of them. He has helped me quickly understand my options and find the best path forward. Big shoutout to him for being a fantastic partner in my journey and making me feel like I have a friend in the process. If you're founder trying to figure out U.S. immigration, Ahmed's your man. Their bug resulted in my underpayment of estimated taxes to the IRSIf you are a U.S. contractor receiving foreign currency pay, refuse to work through Deel. Everything seemed great until I received my 1099-NEC. The USD amount reported on my 1099-NEC for pay received in EUR used an arbitrary exchange rate that resulted in reporting an income much higher than what I actually received (using either spot or forward rates) and what the invoices that Deel themselves had generated reported as my USD pay. This resulted in my underpayment of estimated taxes to the IRS.After 2 weeks of back and forth with customer service, during which I had to push and push for answers to my actual concern and during which I was not allowed direct contact with the technical team actually in charge of this issue, the conclusion from their side was:1. There was a technical bug in the exchange rates used by the invoices that they generated (the exchange rates I used to pay my estimated taxes since I had assumed Deel knew what they were doing and since they were close to the spot rates at the time I was paid)2. The inflated USD amount reported on the 1099-NEC was "correct" and should be used in filing my taxes, even though it used an exchange rate that they could not clearly explain and resulted in an underpayment of my estimated taxes3. A simple sorry for the inconvenienceDeel's website and UI is sleek, so it can give you the impression that they know what they're doing, but critical mistakes like this that are fundamental to dealing with international contractors show that they are not reliable and take no responsibility for their mistakes.Date of experience: January 24, 2024

Deel.com will hire employees or contractors for you - who is legally responsible for their malfeasance? .Deel.com Global Privacy Policy, verbatim - "....third parties include website hosts, data hosts, cloud software providers, IT providers, identification verification providers, customer support providers, payment processors, financial institutions, financial advisors, legal advisors, auditors, and insurance companies......”  Spoke to a Deel.com sales woman based in Florida who agreed the company's EOR - Employer of Record - relationship for client companies is wrought with conflicts of interest when intellectual property is involved. For example, a contracted employee in the Philippines is an employee of Deel.com not one of Deel's clients. If that employee breaches a NDA - Non Disclosure Agreement - the client of Deel.com's has to sue that individual in a Philippines court of law for trade secret theft. Deel.com will not assume the legal liability for the malfeasance of a individual employed under the Deel.com platform. Remember that individual is technically a Deel.com employee not one that belongs to a Deel.com client company. This is a broken business model that surely no one has thoughtfully analyzed with respect to legal issues.Date of experience: October 24, 2023

Retroactive canceling of paymentsThe customer canceled payment at the end of the month, when all the hours had been worked already, and Deel accepted it.It should be impossible to "undo" services that have already been done. However, this is not a matter of solving a dispute, this is a matter of already delivered services simply being "deleted" from the platform. I didn’t get my last salary and they even forgot to deregister me from the Social Security company!The most horrible company I have ever dealt with! It all started wrong - at first they sent me some old template for the contract (I was lucky I was actually reading the stuff and found out it was a bit strange), then they sent me good template of contract but my name was wrong. When I asked them to correct my name, they sent me again wrong template but with correct name. It was endless! My company was hiring me for more than 3 weeks because each correction took 3 or more business days. The CEO of our company was very mad at Deel! Later I found out that if I didn’t literally request data for taxes declaration, I would never get the necessary papers (and according to my country legislation, I should be given this automatically by the employer). Although I had right to ask them to make all the taxes declaration, I was afraid of leaving this stuff up to Deel, because after all that happened, I had zero trust towards them. Then our company went into financial troubles and most of the employees had to terminate their employment, including me. And that’s when another bad story started - according to my country legislation, the employer is obliged to deregister the employee from the Social Insurance company one day after the termination of the employment at the latest. They haven’t deregistered me for more than one month after I terminated. Thanks to this, I wasn’t able to get the social security benefits until now. And what else? Until now, which is over a month and a half, I still didn’t get my last payroll and the last salary. I have contacted their support at least 3 times due to this and all I get is “it will be soon” and “we apologize for the inconvenience”. When I ask what “soon” means, I get no specific answer, just “we hope it will be soon, we will keep you updated” and again apologies. After this horrific experience with Deel, I don’t want to deal with them in the future and I strongly recommend everyone to think about freelancing better than having to experience all of this. HorribleI recently had the unfortunate experience of dealing with Deel's customer service, and I must say, it was absolutely horrendous. The level of assistance I received was beyond disappointing and left me feeling frustrated and helpless.I reached out to Deel's customer service team with a pressing issue that I needed help resolving. Not only did it take an eternity to get a response, but when I finally did, the representative seemed disinterested and unhelpful from the very start. It was as if they couldn't be bothered to address my concerns seriously.As I tried to explain my problem, the representative's responses were vague and lacking in any real solutions. It felt like they were simply copy-pasting generic responses without actually understanding the specifics of my issue.Despite my attempts to provide additional information and clarify the situation, the customer service agent stopped reply.  This level of negligence and incompetence is simply unacceptable, especially when seeking assistance with something as critical as a problem with their service.After wasting valuable time going back and forth with the customer service representative, I still found myself no closer to a resolution. The lack of empathy and genuine concern for my issue was astonishing. It's disheartening to think that a company like Deel, which claims to provide comprehensive support, could fail so spectacularly in this regard.In conclusion, my experience with Deel's customer service was nothing short of a nightmare. The lack of professionalism, the inability to comprehend my problem, and the overall apathetic attitude displayed by their representative has left me with a sour taste in my mouth. I would strongly advise others to think twice before relying on Deel's customer service for any kind of assistance, as it's more likely to exacerbate your problems rather than solve them.Date of experience: August 10, 2023

Quite bumpy customer service experienceThe customer support was really not convincing. I left my employer and wanted to have access to my payslips which are provided through Deel. I reached out to my old employer and they sent me a link through which I could send Deel a message, which I did. Nothing happened for more than a week, so I reached out to my former employer again. This time, they wanted to escalate it.After seven more days, I received a reminder to answer to the email that Deel sent to me - without ever having received the original email. They asked me to provide a lot of data to proof my identity, of which half can be easily found on the internet and the other half is something I would prefer not to share through an email.I anyway provided everything they asked for. A bit later, I received another reminder from another person at Deel apologizing for having sent the first email to the email address I had at my old employer and asking me for the exact same data again. I told them that I already provided the data and luckily, I was granted with access the very same day.All in all a quite bumpy and lengthy process and especially the amount of personal data that needs to be shared through an insecure channel like email is worrying me.Date of experience: August 09, 2023

Tough start (2020) - incredible improvement in 2022We started working with deel end of 2020. The platform was already great from both employer and employee side. What was really lacking was experienced support. The answers from the support were not to the point, required several back and forth, on a chat that would wait for the support agent to connect for over an hour, but close after 5 minutes of their answer if you didn't reply. Therefore, I often had to re-write and re-explain things wholly to a different customer support agent. Very annoying. It's only when we did the first termination in November 2021, that I could see a real customer support improvement. The case was complex as it was linked to residential visa and we were looking for a way for our employee to change job, but not country. Carlos was amazing at supporting us and trying to find a solution. Also over Christmas and New Year's. We had another termination in April, in another country and with another great deel support experience. A year ago, I would have never recommended deel. In  early 2021 I felt like I was training their customer support who didn't understand the difference pay and legal consequences of my questions. In 2022, I would  recommend deel for their support and incredibly easy platform, where both employee and employer have access to all the information they need.Date of experience: June 13, 2023

Dreadful - Avoid **Updated**: Later Experience Saw an ImprovementDreadful, they've cost me time and money. The salesperson said I could be a sole trader on the platform and use my credit card for payments. The first issue is that there's no formal documentation they will accept proving you're self-employed. In the UK, nothing exists, the tax office doesn't issue a self-employment number, and Deel doesn't accept your national insurance number. I had to use my limited company certificate supported by a personal credit card statement. That was still not accepted. I give up. I highly recommend you stay with Upwork if you're considering moving. They allowed me to create six contracts during this period, all six will have to be wound down. There's been a time and money expense for which I'll attempt to get compensation.**Update on this**After posting the above review, Deel's COO contacted me directly and fixed the issue. The system does allow for credit card payments for sole traders. It seems my account was flagged to compliance, who took a narrow approach to my application.  To the COO's credit, I'm going to continue with Deel. I will leave the original review because it's an important part of the context, but I've given more stars - driven by the later experience of the COO reaching out.Date of experience: May 31, 2023

Deel is hands down the best platformDeel is hands down one of the best online platforms for managing remote teams that I have ever used. As someone who has worked in the remote space for years, I can confidently say that Deel has exceeded my expectations and delivered outstanding results.One of the most impressive things about Deel is its user-friendly interface. The platform is incredibly intuitive and easy to navigate, which is a huge advantage when working with remote teams. Whether you are creating contracts, tracking payments, or communicating with team members, everything is organized and accessible in one central location.Another standout feature of Deel is its commitment to compliance. As someone who has dealt with legal issues in the past, I appreciate that Deel takes care of all the legal aspects of hiring and paying remote workers, making it easy for businesses to stay compliant with local laws and regulations.Deel's customer support is also top-notch. Whenever I had a question or needed assistance with something, the support team was always quick to respond and incredibly helpful.Overall, I highly recommend Deel to any business looking for a comprehensive, easy-to-use platform for managing remote teams. Deel now holds 2477.43 USD. Won't refundUPD: our case was solved pretty quick after this review publication and my 'very loud' request to Deel support team. Thank you.Excellent service when it comes to receiving payments and paying employees.However, support is absolutely awful. Deel now holds our money in the amount of 2 477.43 USD and does nothing when we ask for a refund.We paid two invoices in the wrong currency, and Deel could not proceed with them. Deel Payments team contacted us and proposed two options:"1. We can cancel this invoice for you so that you can reprocess the invoice in the currency that we have received. Please note that there may be slight differences in the final amount due to currency changes.2. You can resend the amount in the correct currency. As soon as you send us a proof of payment, we will process the invoice to prevent delays. We can then collect bank details to refund the initial payment back to you."To be honest, the instructions are a bit confusing, so we chose the first option. We thought that already made payments would be cancelled and refunded (!), since Deel confirmed that they had received them.We declined to use Deel for the first payment of 1,514.93 USD, and for the second payment of 962.50 USD we used another invoice and made the payment in the correct currency (our payments were supposed to be in EUR but since we were using Deel for the first time, we made this mistake).I have contacted support at least three or four times. I said that we made a mistake choosing an option, and we need a refund for invoices that have already been paid. They don't understand what we're asking of them. They claim to have paid the same invoice (of course, it is an entirely different invoice and payment). Everything seems fine for Deel, and it makes me feel like I'm the only idiot here.Date of experience: December 07, 2022

Not so great for European contractorsThe customer support is lovely, but not well equipped to deal with withdrawal problems for European contractors.I started having problems with receiving my paycheck from Deel through Wise last month. I've received confirmation from Wise that they have received my funds and sent them to me but the money never arrived. This is the second time in a row this has happened.As per Deel's guidelines, I must wait 5 business days before they can take action.Last time I waited the 5 business days so a full week in total when including the weekend (during which Deel's customer support assured me I would receive my money - and didn't) and only an hour after the issue was escalated I received my money from Wise. It's just a matter of them releasing it. Wise's bank is located in Belgium. They've previously sent the funds as SEPA instant transfers which take mere seconds between 2 European bank accounts. That's why it's so frustrating to be asked to wait for days.That said I am really unhappy I must go through the waiting period again before getting help. I tried to explain that this is not the first time this has happened and last time things didn't get sorted out on their own but I felt that nobody really read what I was writing and just copy pasted info from the FAQ. I would've rather had the support really take the time to listen to my concerns and escalate the problem to the payments team to check just in case, letting them know what happened last time.Unfortunately Wise is the only free option to withdraw money from Deel for me. I'm unsatisfied with the platform and am researching other options to get paid as a contractor. Having to wait a week for a transfer within Europe is not justifiable in today's world. I need quicker action from Deel and cannot keep chasing my money, as surely this will happen again. This is doing serious damage to my mental health and personal finances. This only started happening last month and nobody believes me that it's not normal. Before that, I always received my money within just hours.I would recommend that EU-based remote workers consider using another platform that perhaps has customer support based in Europe for faster and more accurate help when it comes to withdrawals.Date of experience: November 29, 2022

Deel is hiding fees for withdrawal methodsI am using Deel to receive my salary from a client. Deel has advertised a new "instant card transfer" withdrawal method without warning users that this transfer takes quite a significant fee. When I went through the steps to activate this withdrawal method the fee was never once mentioned. I must say I was pretty surprised when I realized the difference between my salary and what arrived in my bank account. After three days of contacting customer support, nobody apologized or helped me in any way. They just provided me links to articles where the fee is mentioned. It's ridiculous to me that the fee is not mentioned anywhere in the app itself nor in the process of actually activating this withdrawal method.  Oh, and by the way, the transfer was not instant at all. My salary arrived in my bank account as quickly as it did by using a regular bank transfer method (1 to 2 days, without fees).Update:5 days and 5 different customer service employees later Deel decided to refund me the fee I was charged with. Hence changing the rating from 1 star to 3 stars. Still not pleased that this happened and that it took so much effort to reach a conclusion which I feel was only just.Date of experience: October 31, 2022

Stay away and find another EOR pleaseThe company hired Deel to sort my work permit in the UAE and it was the most disastrous process I've dealt with.It went on for 2 months only for the lawyer to tell me that they cannot release my entry visa unless I visit the "Ministry of Foreign Affairs" in my home country. Left it to the employee to spend hours of personal time to find out.Bear in mind it was so difficult to even get prompt replies from the lawyer. Days would go by and follow-ups need to be made only for him to tell me he has no information, timeline, or clear steps.Finally, he told me to apply for a separate tourist visa to enter UAE. I managed to find a way to do this - only to get another surprise that it will take 4+ weeks in the UAE to get the employment permit.We decided to stop this process and find another EOR as the timeline has completely messed up my plans and also gone over the deadline of my probationary period.Only after we told them that we are exploring another EOR did a Mobility rep pop in. Watch out for problemsI've been receiving payments from Deel for almost one year and I was very satisfied until now: the funds are received in my bank account on the same day or on the next business day, however, that was not the case with my last payment and now I'm very concerned about how Deel works.Deel says that funds can take up to 5 business days to reach the bank account but I've contacted Deel anyway to confirm that there is no problem with the withdrawal: they confirmed that everything was OK and I should wait the 5 business days. On the next day, I asked them about the status and they decided to forward my case to a different team and that I should be contacted in 48h about the status.There was no contact and I messaged Deel again: they don't know what is happening because the funds were sent to the Payment Processor but Deel can't get an answer from them.I can't reach out to the Payment Processor and I have no idea when I will receive my payment.In summary: Deel works well when there is no problem. in case of problems, they depend on 3rd party services and everything is a black box.Date of experience: October 09, 2022

Beware of hidden fees and non-localized contractsWe were looking for an EOR/PEO and found Deel, talked to one of their nice sales people, and got what on the surface sounded like a good deal.However what they failed to mention was all their hidden fees.Not only do you pay a fee when you make any payment, their currency conversion rates are also very poor, so you end up paying a lot of overhead on transfers. A lot more than you would see with e.g. Wise.And on top of that, they had an incorrect KB article that caused a contract amendment to be finalized too late, resulting in us vastly overpaying an employee. Plus their actual terms means they can delay contract changes at will, leaving you no control of whether the changes will come into effect on time.Also their so called "localized contracts" are not actually localized for a lot of countries - so watch out for that as well.Date of experience: September 30, 2022

Usually it arrives within a few hours (12-16) however this time it took over three days. Naturally I was worried, so I contacted support to review the status of my Advance withdrawal and the service was exceptional. Great with promises, awful with execution. You may NEVER get paidAWFUL!! They were super nice when I was  signing up for Deel, made it sound like they thought of everything. Once we were with Deel it all went downhill like a snowball. I signed up for Deel on the 21st of the month, they decided to charge for the last 9 days a FULL MONTHLY platform fee, stating that it does not matter when I join this is how they bill. During those 9 days I got no service nor payroll from them (they pushed paying for those 9 days by one month), meaning had they been honest and just disclosed this I could have save hundreds by signing up a week later or the first of the next month.Try resolving anything with "customer support", it is not possible, I chatted with them asking a simple question - does Deel have a phone number for support? That was literally my question, the response I got back was that a ticket has been submitted and I will hear back via email in 3-4 business days, no joke, this was their response. No one ever email me a response.I can somehow live with all the above, the real issue was a week ago my employee was supposed to get paid, he's already onboarded and got his first pay check a few weeks ago, however he did not get his last one, there is a paystub which claims it was paid a week ago but no bank transaction...this could also be forgivable, mistakes do happen...the problem is I have no one to get assistance from. On Chat no one has responded to me in four days, I tried a few emails and also got no response, so my employee's paycheck is over one week late and I have no one to communicate with....so now I will spend hours of my time writing reviews in hope that someone from Deel will see my complaint, acknowledge my request and look into why my employee's salary is over a week late. I must look great having no answers for him...needless to say I will be cancelling Deel. They actually bragged about their 12 billion evaluation during the sales pitch yet you can't get someone to help you if the life of your company depended on it. Pay someone to at least pretend to care about your customers, this platform is worthless.Date of experience: June 06, 2022

"Let's Deel" Is a Poor Slogan Choice for a Human Resources FirmMy company is a med-sized scale-up globally dispersed customer facing service company with operations both in the US and Europe. We used Deel for four months to help expand into new European countries, for which contracted them for payroll service. After one month, it became clear we'd made a mistake choosing Deel. They made repeated payroll errors and then used strong-arm mafia-like tactics to crawl back funds from us and from our employees. The first thing to be aware is that Deel operates virtually in each country, whereby they hire a local law office, bizdev manager and onboarding specialist. The law office is essentially a front and provides no meaningful service to you as the Deel client. The bizdev manager is an untrained former management consultant who is completely unprepared to answer any risk management questions about hiring in a new country, and the onboarding manager is essentially a virtual employee who has no meaningful stake in providing quality service. All of Deel's decisions are made by the North American based managers who know little about the foreign markets they work in. Every question is responded with "I'll get back to you". If all of this was not bad enough, they make repeated payroll errors. In our case, which was for a payroll for five employees and monthly expense of  $10k, Deel made over-payment errors on two occasions, including double paying salaries.  Deel uses the deposit you pay as its leverage to force you into cleaning up their mess. You pay a hefty deposit for each employee they hire on your behalf, then when the employee resigns or is fired, Deel holds the deposit until they feel they are made whole even for mistakes of their own making. In our case, they failed to terminate the employee on the date that I directed them to do so, continued to pay the employee, and then realized they had made a mistake and called the former employee to pay back the funds (months later) and then ordered me to pressure the former employee to do so, with the tacit threat that I wouldn't get my deposit back. In that case, the constant calls, emails, texts they made to that former employee was tantamount to illegal harassment. This went on to the point whereby the former employee reported those actions to the local authorities thereby increasing our legal risk exposure, unnecessarily.Another thing to know about Deel is that they charge a monthly fee of about $500 per employee which is very steep. At that rate, it would make more sense to hire a local HR expert who can truly add value and perhaps even help you set up your foreign subsidiary business entity with the savings by not using Deel. The true irony about Deel is that they are a silicon valley globally dispersed platform that exist for one reason, to help other similar type companies handle payroll in other countries, but Deel does not do that one thing well. It does it extremely poorly....so then why do they even exist? They do NOT provide HR service of any kind, no recruiting, no onboarding, no training, no HR support of any kind. The reality is that they will ultimately cost you HR related time and effort and cause frustrations. With their "I'll get back to you"  response issues get dragged on...issues that impact the livelihood of human beings, your current and former employees, who need resolutions (i.e. receive salaries, receive severance payments, etc). The one thing that Deel does exceptionally well is collect your money, such as your deposit and your payments for the payroll. They are extremely slow at returning your deposit. Even under the right conditions (i.e. no conflicts or disagreements) they will take up to a month to return your deposit, which essentially answers the question, why they exist...they exist solely for FINANCIAL FLOAT, which is to say to arbitrage between the timing of money-in to money-out. They do NOT provide any meaningful foreign business presence, nor shield you from any liability...in fact, through their mistakes and strong arm tactics they actually INCREASE your legal risk exposure. Do not count on their legal team to provide any legal advice nor any tax advice. Imagine yourself in this scenario, you contract Deel to help you hire employees in a new country. You pay Deel a sizeable deposit and hefty monthly fee of $500. Then for whatever reason, the employee is let go. But instead of terminating the employee on the date you set, Deel keeps paying the employee salary. Then when you identify the error, Deel starts calling the former employee to return the funds. When you ask about the return of the deposit, the Deel agent in some far away land tells you that you have to recover the funds from the former employee before any deposit is returned. How maddening is that! P.S. The tech support team is helpful and courteous.Date of experience: April 26, 2022

I can't use Deel Card - Deel won't update my contact informationReview update:The issue was resolved. 🙌 Huge thanks to Rachael Were and the Complaints team for their immediate reaction and personal approach.The issue:I applied for the Deel Card in November, and by the time I decided to use it, my address changed. Overly invasive & drip feeds your dataOverly invasive & drip feeds your dataI am an independent contractor in Australia where I use a corporate entity - proprietary limited by shares - that was set up by my chartered accountant to deliver professional services to my global clientele.Or so I have done for a very long time and now suddenly I am forced to use some overly invasive middleman that does not add any real value yet has some rather interesting and scary authoritarian rigid approach to business to business transactions.If you ever have experienced yourself or read the horror stories about PayPal arbitrarily shutting down accounts and then in authoriative manner demanding your first born as well as your biometrics - you can probably relate to my experience already.I do not think they are compliant with AU privacy regulations and I don't feel safe for submitting my personal sensitive information - including biometrics - that reveals protected attributes about myself whilst exposing it to global consumption within unknown jurisdictions that openly opress people like me.They by their words seemingly use Veriff which is some AI startup from Estonia.Veriff on their website seems to say they do some arbitrary facial recognition off some databases. Very anxiety inducing and scary again without being transparent at all.It is not clear what the sole primary purpose for this sensitive information either is but there is some mindless nonsense about that they deal with banks -Well everyone is dealing with banks - Do they pretend being a bank without having a banking license in AU?I don't need another banking facility and I already have SWIFT facility for the clients to pay me for the work completed.Under AU privacy laws sensitive information must have a clear primary purpose and they don't really have a purpose since non-discriminatory alternatives exist.You cannot collect this information "just in case" - you must be enabled by the regulation and they are not.I can go to a notary and get a statutory declaration and this is what banks often use and is covered under AML/CTF implementation as a method to use if you are regulated entity even to begin with.During my 25 years of business I have not seen as a sloppy and invasive business practice as this related to handling identity information.Sensitive personal information is never required for simply receiving payment for services rendered especially if you work via corporate.Not only this but they require my accountant ID and run it into questionable facial recognition process.Stay off from this sloppy company.Date of experience: March 11, 2022

Don't use this companyDon't use this company. They still haven't responded to unemployment office for my claim. It's been over a month. They continue to make false expectations and say need few days. Desires Better - Lack of Transparency and Poor Quality of ServiceI used Deel first to hire a contractor in Japan, whom I later converted to an employee. Deel's Japan setup goes through a 3rd party and frankly has desired a lot more, especially for the amount I'm paying. Unfortunately, this is the only system that works for Japanese employees / contractors and I'd be penalized to leave <6 months after signing up, but I'd switch to a different system in a heart beat. A few of the issues - they auto-signed a contract that I had never seen on my behalf and had it in the system (fortunately they took it down, but had a bunch of hidden fees of the 3rd party and as far as I understand illegal), delayed the start date of my employee leaving a few weeks worth of gaps (without giving me any heads up and never letting me know of the issues - my employee had to deal with it - I had no idea this was going on until my employee flagged it up), and overall feels like they're nickel and diming me. If you don't have a new country set up - do your best to make the experience as smooth as possible, which is imperative with clear communication. Overall, a stressful and unpleasant experience with a provider I've lost trust in (and that's very disappointing for a hiring platform).Date of experience: January 25, 2022

I found my International Hiring Trusted Advisor!Hiring employees can be complicated enough in a country where you understand the hiring process, but having to consider candidates that reside in countries other than your “home” country is overwhelming.  Although I handle the mechanics of hiring employees into our organization, the HR/hiring process is not my area of expertise. I was THRILLED to find out about Deel.  From the very first sales call that I requested, the experience has been the best in terms of functionality of platform, benefit offerings and general ease of working with through the international hiring process.  The Account Executive I’ve been working with (Matt Kaiser) is fantastic.  He was able to read my tone/agenda quickly via our zoom meeting and was able to tailor our discussion to MY questions/needs rather than any pre-canned slide deck/pitch/discussion.  He was extremely responsive to all my follow-up questions about various parts of the onboarding process. Thank you Matt!Date of experience: January 24, 2022

Currently, I am sitting out of pocket for unpaid expenses as well as a portion of my salary from a system error their platform caused 3 months ago. Funds trapped, no help from customer supportI've been unable to withdraw my funds from my Deel account for more than 20 days now. When I initiate a withdrawal, it just keeps pending and their customer support has been completely unhelpful. They initially told me that there's probably something wrong with my bank account details (doesn't help at all that the UI doesn't allow you to see the details of a bank account you've entered before), but I did eventually succeed in withdrawing a small amount through that account (with an unacceptable proportion lost to transaction fees of course), so I know the bank account information is fine.They have been unable to give me the slightest hint on what might be wrong about the transaction and all I get from them is "We'll send you an email when we have more information". I don't think this is an acceptable state of affairs for a platform that you're supposed to trust your money with.In the future, I'll simply provide my clients with a bank account and ask them to wire money directly into it. An intermediary like Deel adds nothing but complexity.Future edit: I've increased my score from 1 to 3 when my issue got resolved at the end of a month, at which point it was revealed that most of the delay was caused by third parties involved. However, I think Deel still contributed significantly to the difficulty of the situation through their complete lack of transparency into what was going on almost throughout this entire period.Edit from the further future: I've been working with Deel for almost 2 years now under a variety of (often very complicated) settings and I've decided to update my review score from 3 to 5 because even though they occasionally make mistakes in their processes, I've always been able to resolve even the most complicated issues with them thanks to their friendly and helpful support people and internal teams.Date of experience: September 01, 2021

Tried Vensure, Deel and PapayaI have tested all the available payroll, vendor management and PEO systems I could and I'm currently working with both Deel and Vensure.Deel is the first payroll related platform that has an interface that lets you do almost everything in1-2 clicks, takes the workload and reporting headaches away and makes me talk to less people in the process. When you start your own startup company, this is exactly what you need. I totally recommend that you try it.Date of experience: August 31, 2021

Slow, unconvenient and lame.Ridiculous amounts of time to do any simple task like withdrawing or even recieving money, and if I want to use MY OWN MONEY before the day they chose, they charge me, reaching out to slow af support about a refund from amazon and they tell me that i have to wait TWO WEEKS, and after two weeks they tell me that they will have to escalate the case, so more waiting for me, such and incompetent, unprofessional and ridiculously lame platform, too slow in every aspect possible, from customer service time to RECIEVING A SIMPLE REFUND.Only remarkable thing is the customer service attitude, but as I know  they have actually nothing to do with the actual company I can call it trash as a whole.Date of experience: August 19, 2021

Support is more confused and more easily distracted than a cat trying to catch a laser pointerDue to delays caused by the COVID-19 pandemic and regular national lockdowns, I came across a problem that required me to seek advice from Deel's "support" team. And I use the word "support" very, very loosely here.As others have said, I was passed from person to person through the "support" system. Every new person I was passed around to seemed more confused than the last. And I had to keep repeating myself because none of the "support" staff read the previous "support" discussions I had with their colleagues.I kept getting asked the same questions over and over. I was given completely different opposing answers from different people. Because I myself work in support at a management level, I used my experience to offer their clearly untrained "support" team advice on how they can actually potentially resolve my issue or at least reach an acceptable diplomatic compromise for both sides, which all fell on deaf ears.It seemed their attitude was "let's send him around in circles and hope he just eventually disappears, trololol".Their "support" team seems to be made up of untrained teenagers working part-time just for a little bit of cash to enable them to go clubbing and get drunk on the weekend. They do not seem genuinely concerned about clients and their money, nor with helping others. Deel needs to re-train or re-staff their entire "support" department. Money is a sensitive and stressful topic for a lot of people in our modern-day world, to the extent it can lead to serious mental health issues for some people. Deel's insensitive nature and appearing not to care that others have bills to pay or people to feed is only going to exacerbate these modern-day mental health issues.I hope Deel can stop chasing laser pointers and get their act together. In my time, I've seen companies collapse into ruin just because of poor support systems - the backbone, first impression and frontine of any company - coupled with their bad training and/or bad recruitment choices, it's a recipe for looming disaster.Date of experience: August 09, 2021

Incompetent is indeed the only wordIncompetent is indeed the only wordEach support gives wishy, washy different answers to questions I ask. Team seems young, inexperienced and either misled by leaders/lacking expertise in HR Product and product-flows look good on outside, but actually have lots of glitches/dont always workMarked up exchange rates seem to be the norm everyone accepts to order to use the platform but my company didnt tell me that when signing upI am planning to convince my company to switch to a better service or see if they can just pay me directly which was easierDate of experience: July 23, 2021

Incredible levels of incompetenceAt first glance, Deel looked like it was going to be incredibly helpful in getting paid for contracted remote work.However, after experiencing an issue with my account, I contacted support. Which has been the worst support experience I have ever had the misfortune of talking to (and I've spoken to Virgin Media, PayPal and EA Games before - all well-known for atrocious support. How wrong I was when I thought nobody could possibly be worse than them...).First of all, rather than one support agent dealing with my query, I was passed around to several different support agents like a cheap joint of weed. This is a terrible customer support system (I have experience in this sector), because a new support agent isn't going to be up to speed on the ongoing support process. One customer = one support agent, not several. The only excuse to pass a customer from one agent to another is if the previous agent is away due to sickness, maternity or vacation (again, I have experience in this sector).Because I was passed from person to person, I was constantly asked the same questions over and over that I had already answered with the previous support agents, which to me shows incredibly high levels of laziness and incompetence as they clearly were not reviewing the support history's discussion. None of them.Aside from that, I was also given completely different conflicting advice and answers from their support agents, which only dragged the whole thing on for longer trying to find out which support agents were right and which were wrong. This shows they have an extremely flawed training program for their support agents and none or lack of official documentations to guide their support agents to providing correct, consistent answers.It has taken over a month wresting with the spaghetti-style tangle that is Deel's support system and the issue is still not resolved. As a result, I have not been paid and Deel are now breaking the law in my country by being late with delivering my funds, so now I'm given no option but to inform my relevant government department that investigates employers and other payment processors when they are late paying citizens.Deel - Looks great and graceful on the outside. A tangled mess of confusion, incompetence, inconsistency and law-breaking late payments on the inside. AVOID like the plague.Date of experience: July 23, 2021

Complexity is not a core competencyAs a business, when we started using Deel we found the platform to be much simpler than other EORs out there. Unfortunately, employee contracts are not as straightforward as a simple interface and there are multiple areas to make sure are done correctly including accounting, specialized contracts, benefits etc. What I've found is that Deel can do the straightforward work but if there is any amount of complexity they do not have the systems in place to respond. For example, some contracts had been refunded but the statements on the accounting tab did not reflect the refunds, which resulted in a multi-week issue tracking down those payments. In addition, an employee asked to change terms in the contract and that took almost 2 months of back and forth (and created a host of other issues including an inability to sign up for healthcare). Most recently they added a 401k fee to all full-time contracts but did not provide a reasoning or an opt-out feature. It seems to me that they are trying to do too many things and as a result are not doing any of them well. At this time I do not recommend working with Deel.Date of experience: June 28, 2021
